account.platform: Playtomic is a global sports technology company, primarily focused on padel and tennis, that connects players with clubs through their mobile application to facilitate court bookings and match organisation. Operating in both B2C (players) and B2B (clubs) markets across nine languages, the company aims to modernise its customer support by transitioning from a rigid, tree-based chatbot provider (Ultimate) to Ada's 100% generative AI platform. Their primary objectives are to achieve near 100% automated resolution for repetitive B2C tasks (match cancellations, refund inquiries), eliminate the heavy manual burden of multilingual content maintenance, and gain actionable insights through real-time API monitoring and advanced conversation analytics.

account.api_requirements:
Playtomic has well-documented APIs for all major use cases.

B2C API Examples:
• List User Past Matches — retrieves matches a player has participated in or booked
• List Players in Match — fetches all participants for a specific match
• No-Show Process — applies penalties to absent players and issues refunds (via Make.com automation)
• Match Validation Check — multi-parameter check for match eligibility
• Fetch User Refunds — checks status of previous/pending refund requests

B2B API Examples:
• Retrieve User/Club Information — authenticates user and retrieves club profile at session start
• Stripe ID Retrieval — fetches unique Stripe identifier for a club
• Get Payment/Payout Details — uses Stripe ID to pull financial data

Authentication:
• B2C: Players must authenticate through sign-in flow before chat to confirm identity (required for match cancellations etc.)
• B2B: Club managers authenticated at session start — Ada retrieves tenant_id and club profile immediately
• Meta-variables populated via SDK also discussed as alternative to API call for passing data
account.segmentation: B2B and B2C use cases differ significantly and will require separate playbooks/routing logic. One agent currently planned — pros/cons of separate B2C and B2B agents to be discussed with PS.
account.product_promises:
• Data Export API with no caps on export volumes
• MCP Actions (Ada as MCP client connecting to external MCP servers) — in roadmap, coming in future months
• Real-time data integration (previously 24hr delay — now resolved)

risks: Double-payment risk: Ultimate contract runs to October 2026 — implementation April–September creates overlap. Commercial solution needed (split contract, delayed conversation billing start).

Multi-conversation capability not currently supported by Ada — Playtomic wants ticket-based conversation retrieval (vs continuous WhatsApp-style chat). Recommendation: use Zendesk widget if multi-conversations critical.
MCP client functionality (Ada consuming external MCP servers) not yet available — on roadmap for future months. Customer understands but PS should set expectations clearly.
9-language requirement with dialect variations is a significant scope item — translation automation is a key value driver but must be scoped carefully.
B2B segment has no defined AR% success criteria yet — needs to be established during PS scoping.
Voice channel is a future phase — voice playbooks not yet ready for full production use; PS to advise timeline carefully.

granola_notes.title: Playtomic x Ada — Catch-up
granola_notes.summary:
Attendees: Raf Silva, Laura Roscam (Ada); Giulio Castiglioni (Customer Care Director), Ashlee Harbert (Knowledge & Training Manager) (Playtomic).

Key topics:
• MCP integration: Playtomic wants MCP client functionality for Ada to connect to internal APIs. Interested in Zendesk MCP for ticket history context (e.g. retrieve previous conversation on same issue). Ada's MCP server is live; MCP Actions (Ada as client) on roadmap.
• Multi-conversation: Playtomic wants ticket-based conversations for easier retrieval of past topics — Ada does not currently support this. Recommendation: use Zendesk widget if this is critical.
• Article pre-loading: Ada can surface contextual articles based on page context (e.g. reports page) and generate responses rather than just linking articles.
• Voice: Wants voice for premium B2B clubs (top 200 in Spain initially). Same agent across all channels. Always disclose AI identity.
• Pricing discussed: €17k implementation, €0.47/conversation, volume discounts >500k. Commercial challenge around overlap with Ultimate contract (ends Oct 2026).
• Team: dedicated AE + Consultant + Engineer; weekly → biweekly → monthly cadence; joint Slack channel; 24/7 technical support; QBRs included.
